messages.subject: Re: Tsuba Kantei #4
messages.msgSnippet: Hmmm...  I m getting to this kantei late...  Guess I have to check in more often!  Anyway, it looks like rather early Akasaka to me (like second generation
messages.messageBody:
Hmmm... I'm getting to this kantei late... Guess I have to check in more often! Anyway, it
looks like rather early Akasaka to me (like second generation Tadamasa), but then also has
a newer look to the metal (or perhaps this is just the tsuba's excellent condition???)... So,
based on what Torigoye/Haynes have to say about Tadashige, I'll go with that choice.
Sorry, not too up to snuff on my Akasaka yet...

Steven

messages.messageBody:
Alex,

It depends where you live.

Also consider the NTHK shinsa in Sept(?) as a fair
option. If you can't physically take it yourself,
there are agents out there <not here> who will handle
it for a small fee.

Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] he said she said
messages.msgSnippet: Have been lurking on the group for months now and have learned quite a bit, thanks all! Does anyone have any suggestions on where to get a credible appraisal?
messages.messageBody:
Have been lurking on the group for months now and have learned quite a bit,
thanks all! Does anyone have any suggestions on where to get a credible
appraisal? I am in a he said she said situation and am being told two
drastically different values for the same item. I need another opinion (or
three or four).

Thanks!

Alex R.
alexr@...
www.OctaviaTea.com

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba Kantei #4
messages.msgSnippet: Akasaka - I wanted to look closer at the surface before I tried to call a smith. I was originally thinking Tadashige like Pete but I tend to think of his work
messages.messageBody:
Akasaka - I wanted to look closer at the surface before I tried to call
a smith. I was originally thinking Tadashige like Pete but I tend to
think of his work as a bit more granular. It's a big tsuba at 85mm, I
think because of the size, the tall tapered seppa dai and the fine hitsu
ana, I will try for the 2nd master Tadamasa.

Cheers

Rich Turner
